Package boofcv.examples.stereo

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ExampleFundamentalMatrix
    A Fundamental matrix describes the epipolar relationship between two images.
    ExampleRectifyCalibratedStereo
    Shows how to rectify a pair of stereo images with known intrinsic parameters and stereo baseline.
    ExampleRectifyUncalibratedStereo
    In this example, two images are rectified using a Fundamental matrix.
    ExampleStereoDisparity
    The disparity between two stereo images is used to estimate the range of objects inside the camera's view.
    ExampleStereoDisparity3D
    Expanding upon ExampleStereoDisparity, this example demonstrates how to rescale an image for stereo processing and then compute its 3D point cloud.
    ExampleStereoTwoViewsOneCamera
    Example demonstrating how to use to images taken from a single calibrated camera to create a stereo disparity image, from which a dense 3D point cloud of the scene can be computed.
